metadata.synopsis: Tara is at the party talking to Gale if he's present at the party organized by Withers.Variants:Gale Alive (reactive to his state, God, Waterdeep, Adventurer)Gale dead (mourning)

10.speaker: Tara the Tressym
10.text: Ugh. I thought the beard was bad before, and now it's glowing.

142.speaker: Player
142.text: Tara! How glad I am to see you!

7.speaker: Tara the Tressym
7.text: I wish I could say the same. I thought you had more sense than this, Gale. I thought you had any sense at all.

203.speaker: Tara the Tressym
203.text: Using your family name was a show of respect. But you've buried that deep in the litter box, haven't you? Godhood. So vulgar.

130.speaker: Tara the Tressym
130.text: Even despite your... changes, it's not too late. Other gods have given up divinity. You could still come home. To me. To your mother. You'd still be our Gale.
130.context: NodeContext: VEry sad, though trying to keep her stiff upper lip

35.speaker: Tara the Tressym
35.text: But you won't. I know you won't. You've followed Karsus straight down the road to ruin. And I won't be there to watch, Gale.
35.context: NodeContext: VEry sad, though trying to keep her stiff upper lip

75.speaker: Tara the Tressym
75.text: I suppose this is goodbye. To you, your wretched ambition, and that gods awful thing on your chin.
75.context: NodeContext: VEry sad, though trying to keep her stiff upper lip

24.speaker: Player
24.context: NodeContext: VEry sad, though trying to keep her stiff upper lip

120.speaker: Tara the Tressym
120.text: Goodbye, Gale. I hope the heavens are worth it.
120.context: NodeContext: VEry sad, though trying to keep her stiff upper lip

111.speaker: Player
111.text: It needn't be. You're still my friend.
111.context: NodeContext: VEry sad, though trying to keep her stiff upper lip

34.speaker: Tara the Tressym
34.text: I was, Gale. Perhaps I will be again, one day. But now... well. Not now.
34.context: NodeContext: VEry sad, though trying to keep her stiff upper lip

215.speaker: Player
215.text: Tara, I expected you to be more reasonable.
215.context: NodeContext: VEry sad, though trying to keep her stiff upper lip

99.speaker: Tara the Tressym
99.text: And I, you. At least we still have something in common.
99.context: NodeContext: VEry sad, though trying to keep her stiff upper lip

185.speaker: Player
185.text: Transform Tara into a hairless cat.
185.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gale waves a hand and Tara poofs into a hairless catNodeContext: dripping with disdain, muttering to herself towards the end

220.speaker: Tara the Tressym
220.text: Oh, very funny. Very godlike behaviour. Is this what Elysium's brought you to? It'll take me a tenday to put this right...
220.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gale waves a hand and Tara poofs into a hairless catNodeContext: dripping with disdain, muttering to herself towards the end

173.speaker: Tara the Tressym
173.text: It isn't too late for you. Other gods have given up divinity. You could still come home. To me. To your mother. To everyone who loves you.

58.speaker: Player
58.text: I know this is a shock, Tara, but please - there's no need to be rude.

243.speaker: Tara the Tressym
243.text: There's every need. If I pretended you hadn't turned tail on every lesson you set out to learn, I'd have no right to call myself your friend.

26.speaker: Player
26.text: Yes, I am rather radiant, aren't I?

19.speaker: Tara the Tressym
19.text: Don't flatter yourself, Gale. You've debased yourself in ways I could never have fathomed.

47.speaker: Player
47.text: Is that any way to speak to the god of ambition?

194.speaker: Tara the Tressym
194.text: The god of driving me to despair, more like! How could you do this to yourself, Gale?

71.speaker: Player
71.text: I'm surprised you still recognised me.

153.speaker: Tara the Tressym
153.text: No transformation or ascension can remove that stench of ambitious desperation.

17.speaker: Tara the Tressym
17.text: Do let me know if you spot a cosy corner near the fire for me, won't you?
17.context: NodeContext: Loving but slightly passive aggressive. referring to the fact she doesn't see much of Gale

29.speaker: Tara the Tressym
29.text: Go on, shoo with you. I'm quite capable of keeping myself amused these days...
29.context: NodeContext: Loving but slightly passive aggressive. referring to the fact she doesn't see much of Gale

32.speaker: Tara the Tressym
32.text: You're here to speak with them, not me, Mr Dekarios. I'll indulge you in my company when we're safely back home.
32.context: NodeContext: Wary, like a cat meeting someone for the first time.

36.speaker: Tara the Tressym
36.context: NodeContext: Wary, like a cat meeting someone for the first time.

216.speaker: Player
216.text: Gale's friend Tara, right? It's good to see you again.

115.speaker: Player
115.text: You must be Tara. It's a pleasure to meet you.

100.speaker: Tara the Tressym
100.text: Yes, I'm certain it is. As for you, well, I've heard congratulations are in order.

176.speaker: Tara the Tressym
176.text: You helped Mr Dekarios save Baldur's Gate from the Absolute, isn't that right?

66.speaker: Tara the Tressym
66.text: And you made significant sacrifices to your well-being, by the looks of things.

157.speaker: Player
157.text: I sacrificed, yes. But I'm happy, too.

85.speaker: Tara the Tressym
85.text: You ought to come visit myself and Gale when you're able. If you can extract yourself from what I'm sure are very important responsibilities.
85.context: NodeContext: A hint of ill will but not too much

82.speaker: Player
82.text: I'd quite like that. Thanks for the invitation.
82.context: NodeContext: Alluding to the fact Tara can be encountered eating the pigeons at the post house.

242.speaker: Tara the Tressym
242.text: We'll send word by pigeon when we've need of you. I used to have a taste for them, but a great many things have changed in recent months...
242.context: NodeContext: Alluding to the fact Tara can be encountered eating the pigeons at the post house.

87.speaker: Player
87.text: No respect for the co-saviour of Faerûn, huh?
87.context: NodeContext: She's quite glad she'll never see you again

152.speaker: Tara the Tressym
152.text: Why, I took time out of my busy schedule to come to your party, didn't I? What greater show of respect could there be?

88.speaker: Player
88.text: No thanks - my responsibilities keep me quite busy.
88.context: NodeContext: She's quite glad she'll never see you again

224.speaker: Tara the Tressym
224.text: More's the pity. In that case, I doubt we shall ever meet again.
224.context: NodeContext: She's quite glad she'll never see you again

23.speaker: Tara the Tressym
23.text: That doesn't sound like him. But whichever way you want to remember it, well done, I suppose.

0.speaker: Player
0.text: If that's what he told you, who am I to argue?

54.speaker: Tara the Tressym
54.text: Well done. Despite my old friend's genius, he'd have blown himself up long ago if not for the help of friends like you and I.

134.speaker: Player
134.text: You just reminded me why I've always disliked cats.

65.speaker: Player
65.text: A greeting from Tara! What have I done to deserve the honour?
65.context: NodeContext: passive aggressive response to the player treating her like a cat.

150.speaker: Player
150.context: NodeContext: passive aggressive response to the player treating her like a cat.

174.speaker: Tara the Tressym
174.text: Something caught in your throat, dear?
174.context: NodeContext: passive aggressive response to the player treating her like a cat.

133.speaker: Tara the Tressym
133.text: Good heavens, dear. What the devil was that?

27.speaker: Tara the Tressym
27.text: Anyway, I hear congratulations are in order.

62.speaker: Player
62.text: I'll take 'hello' over a fireball flung in my direction...

37.speaker: Tara the Tressym
37.text: Well, there he is. Gale, in all his glory. I hope you're happy.
37.context: NodeContext: glory in scare quotes. She's not amused in the least

233.speaker: Tara the Tressym
233.text: 'The God of Ambition'. Have you ever heard anything more ridiculous?
233.context: NodeContext: Her sadness breaking through her harsh demeanour

69.speaker: Player
69.text: I agree, Tara. He's not who he used to be.
69.context: NodeContext: Her sadness breaking through her harsh demeanour

198.speaker: Tara the Tressym
198.text: Not in the least. And who lead him straight to such ridiculous notions, hmm? Who left that crown in the river where any foolish wizard could swim down and pick it up?

91.speaker: Tara the Tressym
91.text: You were looking out for him. I expected better of you.

49.speaker: Player
49.text: I think he'll make an excellent addition to the pantheon.
49.context: NodeContext: Her sadness breaking through her harsh demeanour

164.speaker: Tara the Tressym
164.text: Ambition, aspiration - greed and hubris is all I hear.

12.speaker: Player
12.text: Who put salt in your ale?
12.context: NodeContext: Her sadness breaking through her harsh demeanour

18.speaker: Tara the Tressym
18.text: Karsus himself! He and his bloody crown. And you for that matter.
18.context: NodeContext: Her sadness breaking through her harsh demeanour

15.speaker: Tara the Tressym
15.text: The Gale I knew wasn't like this. He recognised his mistakes. He was contrite. All he wanted to do was live.
15.context: NodeContext: Her sadness breaking through her harsh demeanour

184.speaker: Tara the Tressym
184.text: Unfortunately, he fell into company that turned his gaze toward foolishness. Yes, I mean you.
184.context: NodeContext: Her sadness breaking through her harsh demeanour

8.speaker: Player
8.text: Oh I don't know. I think there's something very appealing about the idea of godhood...
8.context: NodeContext: Her sadness breaking through her harsh demeanour

76.speaker: Tara the Tressym
76.text: You'd best not have any plans to follow in Gale's footsteps. One god at this gathering is quite enough.

172.speaker: Player
172.text: I can't deny, part of me wishes I'd stopped him.
172.context: NodeContext: Her sadness breaking through her harsh demeanour

154.speaker: Tara the Tressym
154.text: As do I. As do I.
154.context: NodeContext: Her sadness breaking through her harsh demeanour

57.speaker: Player
57.text: Don't blame me for Gale's foolishness.
57.context: NodeContext: Her sadness breaking through her harsh demeanour

48.speaker: Tara the Tressym
48.text: But it would make everything so much easier.
48.context: NodeContext: Her sadness breaking through her harsh demeanour

83.speaker: Player
83.text: He wanted to ascend, and he did it. I'm happy for him.
83.context: NodeContext: With a sigh at the start, acknowledging she's being unfair laying the blame entirely on you

31.speaker: Tara the Tressym
31.text: Then you're just as mad as he.
31.context: NodeContext: With a sigh at the start, acknowledging she's being unfair laying the blame entirely on you

139.speaker: Tara the Tressym
139.text: I know there's nothing you could've done to stop him. Not really. Once he'd decided to learn nothing from his mistakes, what use were either of our protests?
139.context: NodeContext: With a sigh at the start, acknowledging she's being unfair laying the blame entirely on you

217.speaker: Tara the Tressym
217.text: Perhaps you'd be willing to come meet Gale's mother, some time? She misses him so - and I know it would do her heart a world of good to discuss her son with someone who knew him as he was.

205.speaker: Player
205.text: I'd love to, but I'm leaving Faerûn after tonight.

98.speaker: Tara the Tressym
98.text: Well if you ever come back do look us up in Waterdeep. Surname 'Dekarios'. I'd enjoy the chance to reminisce about the good man we knew.

211.speaker: Player
211.text: I'd love to, but I'm leaving Faerûn after tonight.

161.speaker: Tara the Tressym
161.text: Jolly good. I'll tell Mrs Dekarios to be expecting you. Oh, she'll be delighted. Things just haven't been the same without himself cluttering up the place.

186.speaker: Tara the Tressym
186.text: See that you do. We'd love to have you. Things have been rather quiet without himself cluttering up the place.

53.speaker: Tara the Tressym
53.text: Do give it some thought. If you change your mind, Mrs Dekarios and I will be only too delighted.

223.speaker: Tara the Tressym
223.text: Enjoy your party, dear. I've heard you quite deserve a celebration.

74.speaker: Player
74.text: Gale is his own man, Tara.

110.speaker: Tara the Tressym
110.text: False. He was mine. Though now he belongs only to his own pride.

21.speaker: Player
21.text: I'd no idea you thought so highly of me. Especially after you threw that fireball...

128.speaker: Tara the Tressym
128.text: Well, I had to check you were worthy of Gale's guardianship somehow. You passed, though by the breadth of a tressym's feather.

56.speaker: Tara the Tressym
56.text: You'd best not have any plans to follow in Gale's footsteps. One god at this gathering is quite enough.
56.context: NodeContext: Rather dismissive, like a parent who doesn't get why your job means anything to you.

94.speaker: Tara the Tressym
94.text: Well, Mr Dekarios. Here you are.
94.context: NodeContext: Rather dismissive, like a parent who doesn't get why your job means anything to you.

42.speaker: Tara the Tressym
42.text: Thought you'd have a night of revelry far from the loving supervision of your favourite tressym, did you?
42.context: NodeContext: Rather dismissive, like a parent who doesn't get why your job means anything to you.

86.speaker: Player
86.text: Tara! I'm so glad to see you!
86.context: NodeContext: Rather dismissive, like a parent who doesn't get why your job means anything to you.

80.speaker: Tara the Tressym
80.text: As you should be! All that time galavanting about space with nary so much as a letter for me or your poor mother!
80.context: NodeContext: Rather dismissive, like a parent who doesn't get why your job means anything to you.

179.speaker: Player
179.text: Sorry, Tara. I'm in the middle of an astral war against a despotic goddess and her army of devoted warriors. I've not found time to write...
179.context: NodeContext: Rather dismissive, like a parent who doesn't get why your job means anything to you.

163.speaker: Tara the Tressym
163.text: Is that so? It's very important, I'm sure. It's always something very important, isn't it, sir?
163.context: NodeContext: Rather dismissive, like a parent who doesn't get why your job means anything to you.

78.speaker: Player
78.text: I'm fine up there, Tara. I promise.

20.speaker: Tara the Tressym
20.text: Well, I'll have to take your word for that. It's quite impossible to inspect you for scratches, bruises, or errant orbs of magic while you're transparent, isn't it?

60.speaker: Player
60.text: I promise - I won't be gone forever. I miss my library, my mother, and you of course.
60.context: NodeContext: Laying on the guilt trip

30.speaker: Tara the Tressym
30.text: Hmph. Well that will have to sate me for now. Your mother will be delighted to know she's in your thoughts, if not your correspondence.
30.context: NodeContext: Laying on the guilt trip

9.speaker: Tara the Tressym
9.text: Oh, really, sir. It can't be more than a week or two since I've visited. My catflap of displacement has barely ceased swinging before I poke my whiskers through once more.
9.context: NodeContext: Feigned giving out. 'Oh, really' like 'Come on!' Then, preening a bit.

230.speaker: Tara the Tressym
230.text: Still... I'm very glad to see you too.

63.speaker: Tara the Tressym
63.text: I trust you're still very glad you chose to live in Hell rather than come home to me and your loving mother?

232.speaker: Player
232.text: Tara, you know why I made this decision...

68.speaker: Tara the Tressym
68.text: Yes, yes, ever the hero. I am so very proud of you, you know. Though I'd prefer to be ashamed of you home together in Waterdeep.

202.speaker: Player
202.text: Laying it on rather thick, don't you think?

225.speaker: Tara the Tressym
225.text: What else is a poor tressym to do when her favourite lap rest is so very far away?

143.speaker: Player
143.text: I'll only be there until we can fix Karlach's heart. Then I promise I'll be back.

235.speaker: Tara the Tressym
235.text: Then you'll bring her home to Waterdeep, won't you? I'll begin working on a little fire-proofing cantrip in anticipation. Can't have the comfy armchair getting singed, can we?

43.speaker: Tara the Tressym
43.text: I trust Baldur's Gate is treating you well?

191.speaker: Player
191.text: Oh, very well indeed. It's rather exciting, exploring a new city.

16.speaker: Tara the Tressym
16.text: Ah, Mr Dekarios, if only all of us could be so footloose and free as you.

219.speaker: Tara the Tressym
219.text: One day, sir, I'll convince you to put your roots down back where they belong. Among your books, near your fire, in view of your dear friend Tara.

125.speaker: Tara the Tressym
125.text: Until then, my suffering must continue.

107.speaker: Tara the Tressym
107.text: Have fun tonight, Mr Dekarios. But not too much. There's a good fellow.

118.speaker: Tara the Tressym
118.text: Would you like a scratch, Tara?

72.speaker: Player
72.text: Would you like a scratch, Tara?

41.speaker: Player
41.text: There's plenty to recommend it. The variety, the people, the cuisine...
41.context: NodeContext: Finishing a list for Gale who lists out things he likes about Baldur's Gate

84.speaker: Tara the Tressym
84.text: The crime lords, the sewers, the apocalypses!
84.context: NodeContext: Finishing a list for Gale who lists out things he likes about Baldur's Gate

226.speaker: Player
226.text: It's no City of Splendours, but I've a very good reason for being there...

214.speaker: Tara the Tressym
214.text: Speaking of which, when are you bringing your paramour home to meet Mrs Dekarios? She's been nothing but questions for six months straight, your poor mama!

155.speaker: Tara the Tressym
155.text: I trust you're enjoying having abandoned your mother and I for adventures abroad?

238.speaker: Player
238.text: You must know I miss you dearly, Tara.

218.speaker: Tara the Tressym
218.text: I know, but it's my duty to guilt you at every opportunity.

112.speaker: Player
112.text: You should come visit Shadowheart and I. There are plenty of mousers around who would enjoy your company.

169.speaker: Tara the Tressym
169.text: Mousers? I'm going to pretend you didn't suggest that, sir. Else I might never forgive you.

200.speaker: Player
200.text: We've important work to do in Limbo.

3.speaker: Tara the Tressym
3.text: Yes, yes, absolutely essential, I'm sure.

127.speaker: Player
127.text: Halsin's commune is lovely, especially this time of year.

101.speaker: Tara the Tressym
101.text: Yes, but I'm at my best all year round.

234.speaker: Player
234.text: I didn't abandon you. But I do have a life beyond Waterdeep - a life worth having.

89.speaker: Tara the Tressym
89.text: You're just trying to be hurtful, now.

239.speaker: Player
239.text: Have you come all this way just to make me feel guilty?

170.speaker: Tara the Tressym
170.text: That's not the only reason, but it was a primary aim, yes.

123.speaker: Player
123.text: Wait - why are you here? I don't recall seeing your name on the invite...
123.context: NodeContext: Slightly eye rolling, loves him really

90.speaker: Tara the Tressym
90.text: Our little trio has a great deal to talk about, what with all you get up to.

116.speaker: Player
116.text: I'm wise enough to know I'm never too far from your watchful gaze, Tara...
116.context: NodeContext: Slightly eye rolling, loves him really

206.speaker: Tara the Tressym
206.text: Watchful indeed. Even with my catflap of displacement, it can be hard to put my paw on you sometimes. All these adventures you insist on having...
206.context: NodeContext: Slightly eye rolling, loves him really

147.speaker: Tara the Tressym
147.text: Oh, hello, darling. I wasn't sure you'd make it.
147.context: NodeContext: passive aggressive tara at her finest

229.speaker: Player
229.text: I'm surprised to see you here, Tara. Delighted, but surprised.
229.context: NodeContext: passive aggressive tara at her finest

189.speaker: Tara the Tressym
189.text: Are you? Withers and I have a regular correspondence. He's joined me and Mrs Dekarios for luncheon on more than one occasion.
189.context: NodeContext: passive aggressive tara at her finest

158.speaker: Tara the Tressym
158.text: Of course we'd love to see yourself and Gale more often, but you keep him so very busy, and we hate to impose...
158.context: NodeContext: passive aggressive tara at her finest

146.speaker: Player
146.text: Do I detect a hint of jealousy?

228.speaker: Tara the Tressym
228.text: I suppose you do. All I ever wanted was for Gale to settle down, but now that he has... I miss him.

167.speaker: Player
167.text: Tara, the life I share with Gale will always include you. You're his oldest and best friend.

188.speaker: Tara the Tressym
188.text: Yes, I am. And you're a dear for putting up with this cranky old tressym. I may show my claws now and then, but I hope I never scratch you too deeply.

38.speaker: Tara the Tressym
38.text: Gale, on the other hand! The way he leaves his potions in absolute disarray - I know for certain he wasn't raised in a barn, but you'd never know it.

137.speaker: Tara the Tressym
137.text: We must begin our campaign to set him on the straight and narrow when we return home.

81.speaker: Player
81.text: I understand you miss him. But he's made the life he wants.

55.speaker: Tara the Tressym
55.text: Well! Then I'll just have to visit more often, won't I? My catflap of displacement wasn't invented to sit on the shelf.

193.speaker: Tara the Tressym
193.text: Now - enjoy your party. You've quite earned it, if the balladeers are to be believed.

106.speaker: Player
106.text: Get over it, cat. The wizard's mine.
106.context: NodeContext: Almost saccharine, but dead serious. Playing it off as mannerly because she's at a party, but she's never been more pissed.

124.speaker: Tara the Tressym
124.text: Call me 'cat' again, and see if you wake up with a trachea.
124.context: NodeContext: Almost saccharine, but dead serious. Playing it off as mannerly because she's at a party, but she's never been more pissed.

227.speaker: Tara the Tressym
227.text: You've made a powerful enemy today. Poor pet.
227.context: NodeContext: Almost saccharine, but dead serious. Playing it off, but she's probably going to scratch your face off later.

117.speaker: Player
117.text: We'd both love to see you more, Tara. Why don't we have tea when we get home?

145.speaker: Tara the Tressym
145.text: I'd like that very much. Thank you, darling.

165.speaker: Player
165.text: Tara, we've been through this. I'm here to be part of your life with Gale, not take him away from you.

140.speaker: Tara the Tressym
140.text: I know that. But I intensely dislike sharing.

22.speaker: Player
22.text: We'd both love to see you more, Tara. Why not pop through that catflap of displacement of yours, and pay us a visit?

213.speaker: Player
213.text: It was never my plan to take Gale so far away. I understand that you miss him.

149.speaker: Tara the Tressym
149.text: Who wouldn't? He's such a precious fellow. All I ever wanted was for Gale to settle down, but now that he has... I didn't expect it to be so hard.

175.speaker: Player
175.text: I wouldn't have missed the chance to see my old friends again.
175.context: NodeContext: passive aggressive tara at her finest

199.speaker: Tara the Tressym
199.text: Yes, you are a very social sort, aren't you? Gale's never been kept so busy in all his days. No wonder his studies are suffering.
199.context: NodeContext: passive aggressive tara at her finest

129.speaker: Tara the Tressym
129.text: But! Such is the way of love, isn't it?
129.context: NodeContext: passive aggressive tara at her finest

231.speaker: Player
231.context: NodeContext: retorting to the sassy player

2.speaker: Tara the Tressym
2.text: I am a personal confidante of Withers himself. He's joined myself and Mrs Dekarios for luncheon on more than one occasion.
2.context: NodeContext: retorting to the sassy player

148.speaker: Tara the Tressym
148.text: Oh, hello, darling. I was hoping to see you. Withers informed me about this little get-together and I thought I'd show my whiskers.
148.context: NodeContext: GAle has died so she's very sad and nostalgic.

208.speaker: Tara the Tressym
208.text: I can almost feel Gale here. Among his friends - in you. Some part of him remains, doesn't it?
208.context: NodeContext: GAle has died so she's very sad and nostalgic.

180.speaker: Player
180.text: Well, his magical ghost is still here, if that's what you mean.
180.context: NodeContext: GAle has died so she's very sad and nostalgic.

104.speaker: Tara the Tressym
104.text: That thing's no more than a shadow of the real man. A nonsense. Though it captures some of his more insufferable qualities...

138.speaker: Player
138.text: It does, Tara. I can feel his presence too.
138.context: NodeContext: GAle has died so she's very sad and nostalgic.

162.speaker: Tara the Tressym
162.text: A crackling in the air, isn't it? That flair of magic and mischief.
162.context: NodeContext: GAle has died so she's very sad and nostalgic.

182.speaker: Player
182.context: NodeContext: GAle has died so she's very sad and nostalgic.

64.speaker: Tara the Tressym
64.text: That's good. We should miss him. He was such a lovely fellow. Proud as a peacock, but... my little love.
64.context: NodeContext: GAle has died so she's very sad and nostalgic.

108.speaker: Tara the Tressym
108.text: Oh, what I wouldn't give to snuggle up on his lap one more time. Just once would do.
108.context: NodeContext: GAle has died so she's very sad and nostalgic.

240.speaker: Player
240.text: Would a fuss from me make you feel better?
240.context: CinematicNodeContext: Can reuse any existing generic animation for players petting cats

197.context: CinematicNodeContext: Can reuse any existing generic animation for players petting cats

207.speaker: Player
207.text: You can snuggle up in my lap later, if you like.

103.speaker: Tara the Tressym
103.text: Oh, I couldn't possibly... unless... well, perhaps it's not a terrible idea. Gale would be quite pleased to know we've made friends, wouldn't he?

114.speaker: Tara the Tressym
114.text: Ah, to lose the one you love the most. What a terrible thing.

5.speaker: Tara the Tressym
5.text: No. Not in this life, at least.

144.speaker: Player
144.text: He's gone. We have to accept that.
144.context: NodeContext: GAle has died so she's very sad and nostalgic.

222.speaker: Tara the Tressym
222.text: I suppose we do. But I certainly wish we didn't.
222.context: NodeContext: GAle has died so she's very sad and nostalgic.

160.speaker: Tara the Tressym
160.text: Now I know you didn't come all this way to see me. Go on - shoo with you.
160.context: NodeContext: sadness in her voice. gale is dead, but she's still being herself

166.speaker: Tara the Tressym
166.context: NodeContext: GAle has died so she's very sad and nostalgic.

171.speaker: Tara the Tressym
171.text: Remember him fondly, won't you? He thought so highly of you.
171.context: NodeContext: GAle has died so she's very sad and nostalgic.

209.speaker: Tara the Tressym
209.text: I think we've said what needed to be said. After all, what use has a god for the wisdom of a tressym?

244.speaker: Tara the Tressym
244.text: Well, Mr Dekarios. Isn't this a familiar sight?

46.speaker: Tara the Tressym
46.text: I thought you'd got past this 'sleeping outdoors and getting smoke in your robes' phase, but here we are once again.

122.speaker: Player
122.text: You didn't have to come, Tara.
122.context: NodeContext: 'people' with a slight note of disdain. They're far less civilised than tressyms

187.speaker: Tara the Tressym
187.text: Would that that were so. But even with your recent penchant for good judgement, I can never be too cautious.

192.speaker: Tara the Tressym
192.text: As far as I'm concerned, you're always on the precipice of making your next terrible decision, sir. I won't be caught unawares again!

61.speaker: Player
61.text: You can't convince me you don't miss it just a little bit...
61.context: NodeContext: 'people' with a slight note of disdain. They're far less civilised than tressyms

59.speaker: Tara the Tressym
59.text: If I were capable of convincing you of anything, you'd have bid farewell to that scruff on your chin a long time ago.
59.context: NodeContext: 'people' with a slight note of disdain. They're far less civilised than tressyms

177.speaker: Tara the Tressym
177.text: But I accept you've made friends among this rag-tag lot. So go on, bash your heads together or whatever it is you people like to do.
177.context: NodeContext: 'people' with a slight note of disdain. They're far less civilised than tressyms

50.speaker: Tara the Tressym
50.text: When you're ready to leave, so am I.
50.context: NodeContext: dismissive, like Gale just offered her a rotten fish

168.speaker: Player
168.text: You could at least try to enjoy it.
168.context: NodeContext: dismissive, like Gale just offered her a rotten fish

52.speaker: Tara the Tressym
52.context: NodeContext: dismissive, like Gale just offered her a rotten fish

190.speaker: Player
190.text: Thank you for coming with me, Tara.

151.speaker: Tara the Tressym
151.text: You can thank me by not blundering into any more world-ending mischiefs for the next decade or three. Ta-ta.

33.speaker: Player
33.text: Don't worry - we'll be done here soon enough.

210.speaker: Tara the Tressym
210.text: Good. Your mother and I are going mushroom foraging in the morning. I'd hate to be too tired to suss the best pickings.

95.speaker: Player
95.text: I could hardly decline an invitation to reunite with my dearest companions.
95.context: NodeContext: Correcting him - Tara is of course his dearest companion

159.speaker: Tara the Tressym
159.context: NodeContext: Correcting him - Tara is of course his dearest companion
